questions.question: What effect did England's practice of salutary neglect have on South Carolina?

choices.answer: allowed SC to give subsidies to other colonies to grow indigo
allowed SC to trade its cash crops only with England.
allowed SC to have a wider market, especially for rice.
allowed SC to form its own government with little influence from England

questions.question: What benefits did South Carolina provide to its Mother Country of Great Britain? (Choose 2)

choices.answer: by supplying African slaves needed to work in British textiles
by providing a source of raw materials
by allowing France and Spain to trade and gain wealth for Britain
by being a market for British manufactured goods

questions.question: What caused the increase in the white population in the backcountry?

choices.answer: The slaves refused to move to the backcountry.
Very few farmers knew how to grow cash crops.
The royal government encouraged settlement of the backcountry.
Indigo could not be grown on such rocky soil.

questions.question: Which region was created to be a safe haven and had a thriving economy based on trade?

choices.answer: New England Colonies
Southern Colonies
Middle Colonies
French Colonies

questions.question: Quote, "If we want to keep order, we have to take the law into our own hands...."

choices.answer: an indentured servant
a colonial Governor
a Lord Proprietor
a Regulator

questions.question: How did the London Company attract immigrants and promote the establishment of large tobacco plantations in Virginia?

choices.answer: created a political system that allowed all people a chance to vote
allowed the people a chance to spread their religion
gave every person coming to the New World free passage
created the headright method and gave people coming the New World land

questions.question: Which of the following was the General Assembly's response to the Regulator Movement?

choices.answer: Backcountry citizens would go to trial without a jury
Seven circuit courthouses were set up around the colony to provide justice
Groups of vigilantes continued to police the Backcountry
The Backcountry was granted equal representation in the General Assembly

questions.question: What was the attitude of the Lord Proprietors towards the colonists in South Carolina?

choices.answer: felt they should stop giving subsidies to the colonists for growing indigo
felt that the colonists were annoying them with their petty disagreements
that they were barbarians who had spent too much time on the the frontier
suggested that the colonists were disobedient and making too small a profit

questions.question: What was the economic benefit of South Carolina becoming a royal colony?

choices.answer: The English government increased subsidies for naval stores
Colonists were allowed to have a say in Parliament
Merchants were allowed to sell rice directly to foreign countries
Merchants were allowed to sell all crops to the open market

questions.question: What was the goal of the Navigation Acts of 1660?

choices.answer: To prevent the British colonies from trading with other nations
To foster trade relationships between the English, Spanish, and the French
To help European settlers navigate the Atlantic Ocean
To help British colonists navigate Native American territories
